snippet: Multiemployer pension plans, often involving unionized workers, were once common in industries like coal mining, trucking and construction. But they’re running out of money.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column notes that annual report released by Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation shows that multiemployer pension plans will most likely run out of money within a few years; warns that absent new legislation, pensions of some retired workers will be eliminated; laments that political system seems unwilling to even consider taxpayer-supported solution.
lead_paragraph: Multiemployer pension plans, often involving unionized workers, were once common in industries like coal mining, trucking and construction. But they’re running out of money.

headline.print_headline: A Strategy for Pensions at Risk of Extinction
headline.main: A Strategy for Pensions at Risk of Extinction
